RHNSD is enabled because we are using an internally controlled RHN Satellite.
Configured by RHEL 6 Hardening script as part of default configuration. Scaned and validated by Retina.
Configured, applied, and enforced by RHEL 6 Hardening Script. Scaned and validated by Retina. System gives 14 days warning - 2 weeks.
RHEL systems should to connect with an RHN Satellite Server. Registration is streamlined via Activation Key. Additionally validated by RHEL 6 Hardening script.

Configured, applied, and enforced by RHEL 6 Hardening Script. Scaned and validated by Retina. System uses pam_passwdqc.so (NSA SNAC recommendation) rather than pam_cracklib.so providing a higher level of security for local accounts.
GPG keys are required for any packages installed on the system.
Configured, applied, and enforced by RHEL 6 Hardening Script. Scaned and validated by Retina.
Backups clients are only installed to backup customer data and various configuration files - systems are generally templated via VM and can easily be recreated.
GPG is used for any Red Hat created RPMs - with the exception of testing RPMs. GPG is used for any package hosted on RHN Satellite or uploaded from a RHEL distribution DVD for patching.
Backups clients are only installed to backup customer data and various configuration files - systems are generally templated via VM and can easily be recreated.
The AIDE package is required by the RHEL 6 Hardening script RPM

Systems have a default firewall configured by RHEL 6 Hardening script. Scaned and validated by Retina. Allows only ESTABLISHED and RELATED packets through, INBOUND "NEW" items are controlled by the system administrator and validated by local IA.

Configured, applied, and enforced by RHEL 6 Hardening Script. Scaned and validated by Retina. Configured by the '/opt/stig-fix/misc/services.sh' script. For added security, Mail is generally disabled unless there is a reason to enable the service.
ADIE configured, applied, and enforced by RHEL 6 Hardening Script in '/opt/stig-fix/misc/gen000140-x.sh' script. Periodic checks are enabled through cron. Scaned and validated by Retina.
Postfix is prefered to Senmai, default in RHEL 6. Postfix is only enabled when needed by underlying tool to preform functionality. Scaned and validated by Retina.
